Directions: Read this passage about art, then answer each question that follows.
Title: Passage 2: Kareem Waris Olamilekan: Teen Artist
Subtitle: “Whenever I draw, I feel so happy.”
Content: Kareem Waris Olamilekan is a teen artist from Nigeria in Africa. He is famous for drawing pictures of people that look lifelike. Many people say his drawings look so real that they remind them of photographs.
Kareem started drawing at the age of 6 when he would draw with his friends. He learned how to draw by studying comics and pictures from books.

At the age of 8, Kareem began attending a school for artists. At his school, he learned special ways to make his drawings look even more real. Kareem became so good at drawing that he started selling his artwork. At age 11, he was even invited to draw the president of France!

Now, Kareem wants to keep improving his skills. His goal is to see his art in the great museums of the world. He was once asked what advice he has for other young artists. Kareem said that it is important to be patient and keep working hard.
Even though Kareem pushes himself to keep working at his art, he has not lost the joy he felt when drawing with his friends. He still loves to draw. Being famous has not changed that.
He says, “Whenever I draw, I feel so happy.”
